intro: Siphocampylus lobbii var. megodontus, commonly known as the giant siphocampylus, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a robust, branched stem that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance, and are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Native to the highlands of eastern Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland habitats.
